name: fctems-override

datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: utmgrp

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: utmgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: utmgrp

DELETE.summary:
Delete this specific resource.
 Access Group: utmgrp

help: Configure FortiClient Enterprise Management Server (EMS) entries.

status.name: status
status.help: Enable or disable this EMS configuration.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable EMS configuration and operation.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable EMS configuration and operation

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable EMS configuration and operation.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable EMS configuration and operation

options.name: none
options.help: FortiClient EMS entry not dirty.
options.label: None
options.description: FortiClient EMS entry not dirty

options.name: mismatched-ems-sn
options.help: FortiClient EMS entry dirty because EMS SN is mismatched with configured SN.
options.label: Mismatched Ems Sn
options.description: FortiClient EMS entry dirty because EMS SN is mismatched with configured SN

fortinetone-cloud-authentication.name: fortinetone-cloud-authentication
fortinetone-cloud-authentication.help: Enable/disable authentication of FortiClient EMS Cloud through FortiCloud account.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable authentication of FortiClient EMS Cloud through FortiCloud account.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable authentication of FortiClient EMS Cloud through FortiCloud account

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable authentication of FortiClient EMS Cloud through FortiCloud account.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable authentication of FortiClient EMS Cloud through FortiCloud account

cloud-authentication-access-key.name: cloud-authentication-access-key
cloud-authentication-access-key.help: FortiClient EMS Cloud multitenancy access key

server.name: server
server.help: FortiClient EMS FQDN or IPv4 address.

https-port.name: https-port
https-port.help: FortiClient EMS HTTPS access port number. (1 - 65535, default: 443).

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable pulling FortiClient user SysInfo from EMS.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable pulling FortiClient user SysInfo from EMS

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable pulling FortiClient user SysInfo from EMS.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable pulling FortiClient user SysInfo from EMS

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable pulling client vulnerabilities from EMS.
options.label: Enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable pulling client vulnerabilities from EMS.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable pulling client vulnerabilities from EMS

options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable pulling FortiClient user tags from EMS

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable pulling FortiClient user tags from EMS.
options.label: Disable

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable pulling FortiClient malware hash from EMS.
options.label: Disable

options.name: fabric-auth
options.help: Allow this FortiGate unit to load the authentication page provided by EMS to authenticate itself with EMS.
options.label: Fabric Auth
options.description: Allow this FortiGate unit to load the authentication page provided by EMS to authenticate itself with EMS

options.name: silent-approval
options.help: Allow silent approval of non-root or FortiGate HA clusters on EMS in the Security Fabric.
options.label: Silent Approval
options.description: Allow silent approval of non-root or FortiGate HA clusters on EMS in the Security Fabric

options.name: websocket
options.help: Enable/disable websockets for this FortiGate unit. Override behavior using websocket-override.
options.label: Websocket
options.description: Enable/disable websockets for this FortiGate unit

options.name: websocket-malware
options.help: Allow this FortiGate unit to request malware hash notifications over websocket.
options.label: Websocket Malware

options.name: push-ca-certs
options.help: Enable/disable syncing deep inspection certificates with EMS.

options.name: common-tags-api
options.help: Can recieve tag information from New Common Tags API from EMS.
options.label: Common Tags Api
options.description: Can recieve tag information from New Common Tags API from EMS

options.name: tenant-id

options.name: client-avatars

call-timeout.help: FortiClient EMS call timeout in seconds (1 - 180 seconds, default = 30).

out-of-sync-threshold.name: out-of-sync-threshold
out-of-sync-threshold.help: Outdated resource threshold in seconds (10 - 3600, default = 180).

send-tags-to-all-vdoms.name: send-tags-to-all-vdoms
send-tags-to-all-vdoms.help: Relax restrictions on tags to send all EMS tags to all VDOMs

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable sending tags to all vdoms.
options.label: Enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable sending tags to all vdoms.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable sending tags to all vdoms

websocket-override.name: websocket-override
websocket-override.help: Enable/disable override behavior for how this FortiGate unit connects to EMS using a WebSocket connection.

options.name: enable
options.help: Do not override the WebSocket connection. Connect to WebSocket of this EMS server if it is capable (default).
options.label: Enable
options.description: Do not override the WebSocket connection

options.name: disable
options.help: Override the WebSocket connection. Do not connect to WebSocket even if EMS is capable of a WebSocket connection.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Override the WebSocket connection

interface-select-method.name: interface-select-method
interface-select-method.help: Specify how to select outgoing interface to reach server.

options.name: auto
options.help: Set outgoing interface automatically.
options.label: Auto
options.description: Set outgoing interface automatically

options.name: sdwan
options.help: Set outgoing interface by SD-WAN or policy routing rules.
options.label: Sdwan
options.description: Set outgoing interface by SD-WAN or policy routing rules

options.name: specify
options.help: Set outgoing interface manually.
options.label: Specify
options.description: Set outgoing interface manually

interface.name: interface
interface.help: Specify outgoing interface to reach server.

trust-ca-cn.name: trust-ca-cn
trust-ca-cn.help: Enable/disable trust of the EMS certificate issuer(CA) and common name(CN) for certificate auto-renewal.

options.name: enable
options.help: Trust EMS certificate CA & CN to automatically renew certificate.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Trust EMS certificate CA & CN to automatically renew certificate

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not trust EMS certificate CA & CN to automatically renew certificate.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Do not trust EMS certificate CA & CN to automatically renew certificate

verifying-ca.name: verifying-ca
verifying-ca.help: Lowest CA cert on Fortigate in verified EMS cert chain.
